description:
This beautiful studio apartment is the 3rd floor of a remodeled tri-plex in the up-and-coming neighborhood of Brewerytown. The unit is clean, comfortable, and gets a tremendous amount of natural light. The appliances include refrigerator, range, dishwasher, and garbage disposal. All a fairly new.

The building is on a nice quiet street one block from the Discovery Center (https://www.discoveryphila.org/) so there is unlimited outdoor space very close by. It's also one block from a golf driving range and Kelly Drive, Philly Art Museum, Philly Zoo are all close by too.

description: Welcome to Byrne Lofts, one of Phoenixville's coolest pieces of history. This circa 1895 Corset Mill was converted into 32 unique loft-style units in the heart of downtown Phoenixville. This is your opportunity to own Unit #111 in one of the best locations on the main floor close to the gym, the main entrance with mail/package room, and just steps to the exit to your personal deeded parking spot #32 (which includes an electric outlet if you need a car charging station). Open floor plan is perfect for entertaining friends, the beautiful kitchen features Granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, upgraded cabinets, and a large island. This one-bedroom unit features an upgraded tiled bathroom, and washer and dryer in the unit. Don't miss the large storage cabinet offering room for lots of boxes, bins, skis, etc. The secure building includes a fitness center, places to hang and lock your bike inside, community room, and an outdoor community deck. Phoenixville is located at the junction of French Creek and the Schuylkill River, offering many outdoor activities including biking/walking path and boat launch. Downtown offers 10 craft breweries, one distillery, plus numerous restaurants, shops, Colonial Theatre, and farmers market. Close to King of Prussia Mall, Valley Forge Park, and Providence Town Center and Routes 422, 202, 76 & 276.

title: weather, as is the patio. Close to everything, and located within hist
description: A convenient, easy lifestyle beckons you to this exceptional home in Hershey Mill. Home was two bedroom, renovated and converted to a one bedroom with den. (Floor plan can be adjusted to suit your needs). The many updates and renovations, including to the kitchen and bathrooms, make this home a pretty, welcoming oasis. While summer days may seem far now, the private pool at Eaton Village is a wonderful plus during warm weather, as is the patio. Close to everything, and located within historic Chester County, Hersheys Mill has so much to offer, with its low-maintenance, carefree lifestyle a real draw. The parking spot and garage with man door are close to the home. From the front door, with a recently replaced storm door, the wood-floored foyer leads you into this lovely abode. The open-concept living room/dining room area has a vaulted ceiling with a window, and a wood-burning fireplace for cozy cool evenings. Sliders lead to the private patio, with plenty of room for summer barbequing and entertaining. From the living room/dining area, the recently improved kitchen is both pretty and wonderfully functional, with clean, white cabinets and Corian countertops, stainless steel appliances, and attractive wood floors. The charming breakfast area has a large window with a pretty view; the table and chairs are also available for sale with the home. A pantry closet allows for extra storage here as well. The main, carpeted bedroom is attractive, with lovely windows and two closets for plenty of storage. The main bath, recently renovated, has an oversized, step-in shower. The vanity is particularly eye-catching, with a marbled top and lots of drawers. The second bedroom, currently used as a den, is carpeted, with a nice closet and windows. There are also pull-down stairs here for attic storage. A recently renovated powder room is located just off the hall. Outside, the lovingly landscaped patio is perfect for enjoying nature. The garage, just a short walk from the front door, also has a man door for additional access. There are numerous amenities at Hersheys Mill, including a Community Center, library, pool, golf course, tennis courts, wood shop, walking trails, and opportunities for trips to museums and other attractions. There are so many group activities available, which makes the community appealing for social residents. For quieter pursuits, including birdwatching, the private walking trails are wonderful. Eaton Village, attractive and well-cared for, has newer siding, roofs, and walkways. The village also offers a private pool for exercise and cooling days during the summertime. Located within historic Chester County, Hersheys Mill is within easy access to the towns of Malvern and West Chester, as well as major thoroughfares, including West Chester Pike and Route 202. Its location is also close to Peoples Light theater, shops, restaurants, and parks, including East Goshen Park, a particularly pretty spot. Welcome to Hersheys Mill!

Shared laundry is located in the building. Located in the heart of the city near Penn Hospital, Jefferson, and plenty of restaurants.
Pet Policy

Contact Annie to schedule a showing!
Annie Oliver

This beautiful townhome features 3 bedrooms, 3 full bathrooms, 2 PARKING SPACES, hardwood floors and updates throughout. There is a balcony just off the living room where you can enjoy unobstructed views of the beautiful neighborhood (no houses in front of you, just nature!). On the same floor down the hall you'll find the master bedroom with hardwood floors, vaulted ceilings, walk-in closet and the master bathroom with double vanities.
The third bedroom is a spacious loft- bedroom with seating area and yes - another full bathroom! This space makes for a great guestroom, office, playroom or whatever you want. Best of all, 2 car PARKING at no extra cost. This includes a 1 car GARAGE and the parking pad behind it. The garage has custom built shelves for additional storage space.
This gated community is near Fairmount Park with easy access to bus & trolley routes to center city, U Penn, Drexel and Temple. It's proximity to 76 ramp, Ben Franklin Parkway, 676 & 95 make it a breeze to get in-and-out of the city. Just a short walk to Fairmount Park, Kelly Drive, Art Museum, Boat House Row, & Philadelphia Zoo. Within walking distance you'll also find Aldi's, Wine & Spirits, The Monkey and the Elephant coffee house, Ryebrew, Green Eggs Cafe, Brewerytown Food Hall, 2637 Brew, Chinese takeout, soul food, Indian food, pizza and so much more.
